Name: Polychrome Glass Vase
Description: This type of polychrome glass vase appeared for the first time in the Eighteenth Dynasty. The glass vases were not blown, but molded hollow around a clay mandrel, or rod, that was removed when the glass became cooler. The technique enabled artists to form vases with elongated necks or bases or even to add parts separately, such as the handles on some of these vases.
